revised_title: Conservation Laws of Nonlinear Chromatography for Heterovalent Ions
tldr: The author studies the conservation laws of nonlinear chromatography for mixtures of heterovalent ions, focusing on the ideal model that neglects interactions between adsorbed species. They prove that when diffusion is neglected, the system is hyperbolic and investigate the changes of concentrations and affinities across shocks. The author also demonstrates that a transformation that decouples the system in the homovalent case does not exist for mixtures of heterovalent ions.
